original: @323b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @323b rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya pra t'i tya sa mutp'a da n'a ma mah'a ya na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya pra t'i tya sa mutp'a da n'a ma mah'a ya na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-pratītyasamutpāda-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: Ārya-dependent origination called the Mahāyāna Sūtra

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha and all Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i gnas na aar mo ni ga lta bu'i rdo leb la tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rnams dang / 'phags pa byams pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i gnas na aar mo ni ga lta bu'i rdo leb la tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rnams dang / 'phags pa byams pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang /
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling in the abode of the Thirty-three Gods, on a flat rock like a polished crystal, together with the great śrāvakas such as the Venerable Aśvajit, the noble Maitreya, the noble Avalokiteśvara,

original: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan rin po che dpag tu med pas brgyan pa rnams dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa chen po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan rin po che dpag tu med pas brgyan pa rnams dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa chen po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang /
translated: and the lords of the Sahā world, the great Brahmā, Nārāyaṇa, Maheśvara, and so forth,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / dri za'i rgyal po zur phud lnga pa la sogs pa dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / dri za'i rgyal po zur phud lnga pa la sogs pa dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
translated: and the lord of the gods Śakra, and the gandharva king Pañcaśikha, and so forth.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyan ras gzigs dbang phyug stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga ri rab kyi rtse mo la btsugs te @324a *//
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyan ras gzigs dbang phyug stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga ri rab kyi rtse mo la btsugs te @324a *//
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and placed his right knee on the peak of Mount Sumeru.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: lha 'di dag ni; mchod rten bgyid par 'tshal ba sha stag ste /
analyzed: lha 'di dag ni; mchod rten bgyid par 'tshal ba sha stag ste /
translated: These gods are all worthy of worship.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir mchis na /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir mchis na /
translated: Since they are present in this assembly,

original: ci nas tshangs pa'i bsod nams 'phel ba dang / lha dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ci nas tshangs pa'i bsod nams 'phel ba dang / lha dang bcas pa /
translated: the Blessed One should teach them the Dharma in such a way that the merit of Brahmā increases,

original: bdud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa /
translated: together with the gods,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgyu las dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag bsod nams shin tu mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgyu las dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag bsod nams shin tu mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la chos bstan du gsol /
translated: the world with its Māras and Brahmās, and the beings with their monks and brahmins, so that the merit of the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers increases greatly.”

original: zhes zhus pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /🔽ye dharm'a he tu pra bha bla he tunte sh'anta th'a ga to hya ba data /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa / ye dharm'a he tu pra bha bla he tunte sh'anta th'a ga to hya ba data /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse on dependent origination:🔽“All phenomena arise from a cause. The Tathāgata has declared the cause.

original: ti sh'anytsa yo ni ro dha ae bam b'a d'i ma h'a shr'a ma na:/
analyzed: ti sh'anytsa yo ni ro dha ae bam b'a d'i ma h'a shr'a ma na:/
translated: The great renunciant has also declared this cause.

original: chos gang rgyus byung de dag gi /🔽rgyu dang de 'gog gang yin pa //
analyzed: chos gang rgyus byung de dag gi / rgyu dang de 'gog gang yin pa //
translated: “Any phenomena that arise from causes🔽The Tathāgata has taught their causes

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te //
translated: And also that which is their cessation.

original: dge sbyong chen pos de skad gsungs //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen pos de skad gsungs //
translated: The Great Ascetic has spoken thus.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: “Avalokiteśvara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: This dependent origination

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /
translated: is the Dharma body of the Tathāgatas.

original: sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des de bzhin @324b gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des de bzhin @324b gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination sees the Tathāgata.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Avalokiteśvara,🔽if a faithful son or daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo dad pa can gang la la zhig gis mi gnas pa'i sa phyogs su mchod rten ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dad pa can gang la la zhig gis mi gnas pa'i sa phyogs su mchod rten ni /
translated: were to build a stūpa in a place without a stūpa,

original: skyu ru  'bru tsam /
analyzed: skyu ru  'bru tsam /
translated: the size of a jujube fruit,

original: srog shing ni /
analyzed: srog shing ni /
translated: with a life-tree

original: khab tsam / gdugs ni /
analyzed: khab tsam / gdugs ni /
translated: the size of a needle,🔽and a parasol

original: ba ku la'i me tog tsam zhig byas la /
analyzed: ba ku la'i me tog tsam zhig byas la /
translated: the size of a bakula flower,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings kyi tshigs su bcad pa nan gdu bzhung na; des tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings kyi tshigs su bcad pa nan gdu bzhung na; des tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If one recites the verses of the Dharma-dhātu of dependent origination, one will generate the merit of Brahmā.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, one will be reborn in the world of Brahmā.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas nyan thos de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yid rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas nyan thos de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yid rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus, those śrāvakas, those bodhisattvas, the entire assembly, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Mahāyāna sūtra The Origination of Dependent Origination is completed.
